noun.description: A shaped piece or ring of rubber or other material sealing the junction between two surfaces in an engine or other device.
examples: oil was leaking from the gasket between the drive flange and the hub

noun.description: A cord securing a furled sail to the yard, boom, or gaff of a sailing vessel.

origin: Early 17th century (in gasket (sense 2)): perhaps from French garcette thin rope (originally little girl), diminutive of garce, feminine of gars boy.
